DataElement.preferredName: Patient Monoclonal Antibody Personal Medical History Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary. An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast-growing cells i.e., hybridoma. Hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis, and treatment. A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies. An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied._The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast-growing cells i.e., hybridoma. Hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast-growing cells i.e., hybridoma. Hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis, and treatment.

Property.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Admin - Associated Property, Removed duplicate terms from Long Name and duplicate definitions included in Definition after correction was requested by curator. 9/25

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has had a prior monoclonal an
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has had a prior monoclonal antibody for a non-cancer therapy indication within 4 weeks prior to study Day 1 or who has not recovered (i.e., <= Grade 1 or at baseline) from AEs due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has had a prior monoclonal antibody for a non-cancer therapy indication within 4 weeks prior to study Day 1 or who has not recovered (i.e., <= Grade 1 or at baseline) from AEs due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has had a prior monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks prior to study Day 1, or has not recovered (i.e., <= Grade 1 or at baseline) from adverse events (AEs) due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier (see protocol for exceptions).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has had a prior monoclonal antibody for a noncancer therapy indication within 4 weeks prior to study Day 1 of retreatment or who has not recovered (i.e., <= Grade 1 or at baseline) from AEs due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier
